code:
@triton.jit
def fused_max_pool_clamp_kernel(
    input_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    clamp_min,
    clamp_max,
    input_n_stride, input_c_stride, input_h_stride, input_w_stride,
    output_n_stride, output_c_stride, output_h_stride, output_w_stride,
    N, C, H, W,
    BLOCK_SIZE: tl.constexpr
):
    pid_n = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_c = tl.program_id(1)
    pid_linear = tl.program_id(2)
    
    # Calculate output spatial dimensions
    H_out = H // 2
    W_out = W // 2
    num_spatial = H_out * W_out
    
    # Check bounds
    if pid_n >= N or pid_c >= C or pid_linear >= num_spatial:
        return
    
    # Convert linear index to 2D spatial indices
    pid_i = pid_linear // W_out
    pid_j = pid_linear % W_out
    
    input_offset = pid_n * input_n_stride + pid_c * input_c_stride
    output_offset = pid_n * output_n_stride + pid_c * output_c_stride + pid_i * output_h_stride + pid_j * output_w_stride
    
    h_start = pid_i * 2
    w_start = pid_j * 2
    
    # Instead of vectors, we compute the four positions explicitly
    h0 = h_start
    h1 = h_start + 1
    w0 = w_start
    w1 = w_start + 1

    # Check the bounds for each of the four positions
    mask0 = (h0 < H) & (w0 < W)
    mask1 = (h0 < H) & (w1 < W)
    mask2 = (h1 < H) & (w0 < W)
    mask3 = (h1 < H) & (w1 < W)

    # Compute the pointers for each position
    ptr0 = input_ptr + input_offset + h0 * input_h_stride + w0 * input_w_stride
    ptr1 = input_ptr + input_offset + h0 * input_h_stride + w1 * input_w_stride
    ptr2 = input_ptr + input_offset + h1 * input_h_stride + w0 * input_w_stride
    ptr3 = input_ptr + input_offset + h1 * input_h_stride + w1 * input_w_stride

    # Load the values, setting out-of-bound elements to -inf
    val0 = tl.load(ptr0, mask=mask0, other=float('-inf'))
    val1 = tl.load(ptr1, mask=mask1, other=float('-inf'))
    val2 = tl.load(ptr2, mask=mask2, other=float('-inf'))
    val3 = tl.load(ptr3, mask=mask3, other=float('-inf'))

    # Combine the values
    window = tl.stack([val0, val1, val2, val3])
    max_val = tl.max(window, axis=0)
    clamped = tl.minimum(tl.maximum(max_val, clamp_min), clamp_max)
    
    tl.store(output_ptr + output_offset, clamped)
